thread.title: I am not leaving Nasa, says Kalonzo Musyoka
thread.title_full: I am not leaving Nasa, says Kalonzo Musyoka

title: I am not leaving Nasa, says Kalonzo Musyoka
text:
I am not leaving Nasa, says Kalonzo Musyoka Tuesday February 7 2017 Wiper party leader Kalonzo Musyoka addresses journalists at Ufanisi Hotel in Kisii Town on February 07, 2017. PHOTO | RUTH MBULA | NATION MEDIA GROUP In Summary Wiper party boss Kalonzo Musyoka said his decision to ask fellow Cord partners to support him in his bid for the presidency should not be interpreted to mean that he is breaking away from Nasa. Mr Musyoka has been in the Kisii region for the past two days mobilising residents to register as voters. Advertisement More by this Author 
Wiper party boss Kalonzo Musyoka has pledged to stick with the newly minted opposition Nasa coalition. 
Mr Kalonzo has also dismissed claims that his party is considering bolting out of the alliance to run a splinter third-force campaign as malicious. 
Addressing journalists at Ufanisi Hotel in Kisii Town early Tuesday, Mr Musyoka said his appearance at the first Nasa rally in Bomet on Saturday was an indication that he was in the alliance to stay. 
“I am in Nasa to stay, unless the national delegates convention decides otherwise. 
"If they say I am not fit to represent the party in any position, it is only then that I can abide and of course with proper reasons,” he said. 
Mr Kalonzo also denied claims that he has a list of preferred Wiper candidates for various seats in his Ukambani backyard. Related Content
